itemDescription: British barrister, businessman and schools minister (born 1949)

wikipedia_page.main: John Alfred Stoddard Nash, Baron Nash (born 22 March 1949) is a British former businessman, also formerly a Conservative Parliamentary Under Secretary of State for Schools and co-founder of the charity Future, which was founded in 2005 which sponsors academies. Nash was Chair of the British Venture Capital Association (1988–89) and on the board of the Conservative think-tank, the Centre for Policy Studies. He is joint chairman of the Governors of Pimlico Academy.

response: *John Nash, Baron Nash (born 1949), British peer, government minister and businessman

link_mentions.page: List of barons in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: In October 2013, a letter from John Nash, Baron Nash showed that early access results were below the minimal standard with only 32% of pupils achieving 5 GCSEs at grades A*-C including English and mathematics – an 18% drop from 2012. An external education advisor criticised the quality of both teaching and pupil assessment.
